description: From Middle French pilastre, from Italian pilastro. Equivalent to pillar +â€Ž -aster.

entries.meaning: (decorative architecture) A rectangular column that projects partially from the wall to which it attached; it gives the appearance of a support, but is only for decoration.
(structural architecture) A column or short wing wall attached to the foundation wall which provides lateral support, or to support a vertical load that does not fall on the foundation wall.
